name: eval-and-replace
description: Execute JavaScript code and replace the code with the result

eval-and-replace.escapeStrings.markdownDescription: If true, when the result of a replacement is a string, it will be kept as a valid string literal (as if it were passed to `JSON.stringify`). Set to false to remove quotes and escaped characters

eval-and-replace.showErrorStacks.markdownDescription: If true, errors which occur during evaluation of the pre-initialized script or selections will be shown in a notification containing their full stack trace. If false, only the error name and message will be included in the notification.

eval-and-replace.compact.markdownDescription: If true, the results of evaluations will be displayed on a single line. If false, multiple lines will be used.

eval-and-replace.timeout.markdownDescription: Timeout for each selection in milliseconds.

eval-and-replace.preinitializedScript.markdownDescription: The value of this setting is executed one time before anything else, after you run the 'Eval and Replace: JS' command, in the context which each selection is then executed in. Use it to pre-initialize variables or add custom functions.
